comment: Well, weddings are a giant ripoff to start with, anyways

This just in: Subway "bread" isn't bread. Is cake.
apparently it's something about it being 5% sugar, where to be bread in eu it needs to be >1%
According to the Irish Supreme Court, Subway "bread" does not meet the requirements to be considered a staple food under their laws
The dough is 10% sugar by weight
Glad I never really went there, then xD

the unassuming ones can often be big surprises.
there was some old aristocrat that started building a "castle" in a city nearby on a hilltop, you'd never know it was there.
the view would be like this, but I'd have worked for it damn it https://i.imgur.com/AHXEJ2I.jpg
good place for a picnic lunch
there's so many "lesser" peaks in the white mountains that have vies some of even the bigger mountains don't
the best one are in the shadow of a larger one
So you get a sense of scale looking up at the bigger peak
looking up a ridge line can be disorienting
the picture I shared is actually from last year
yis, yeah I have more eyepopping photos of this same hike from a few years ago, I did it agian because the forest service huts have "badges" and I forgot my money last time xD
but the waterfalls were nice and there's a lot to see
The colors were NICE, but there was a storm that dulled the colors a little a few days ago
It was AMZING I guess last week, the dryness has caused the leaves to drop very quickly
Here's where the "Man in the Mountain" would have been:
he fell so long ago now
though the lesser known "Indian Head" rock formation does still exist.
that is actually impressive too, cuz the trees on the ridge imitate a headress
but yeah the colors today were vibrant in pockets, basically where the wind didn't get to
Here's the pictures from the last time I did this hike (cuz they're better anyway):

Supremely happy with my new buds.
Spazz, I'll bring the Bluetooth adapter in to work, I have IPads there and can see if it connects easily there as well.
FWIW, I wouldn't get the SE424 model for general music and media consumption, but the SE215's are absolutely worth it.
I've been getting ads from SHURE thanks to you.  Could be worse.
No joke, these aren't leaving my booth after tonight.
I have Dumbo ears and glasses, so headsets, no matter how comfy, always end up painful after enough time.
I've got a couple headsets that don't seem to bother me at all
Having deadass accurate IEMs that just pop in and you forget they're there? Absolutely worth.
we're you talking about Bluetooth car adapters or the earbuds? I've had the Kinivo BTC450 in the past it works great in cars.
What are they? For me, they have to not leak any sound, so either in ear, or over ear closed backs.
the designers at our work though have a square looking one I'm not sure what it is though, that works good too
The Bluetooth for me is (probably) not even gonna get used again, everything I have is 3/5 compatible.
But they came in the box and Spazz was asking about Bluetooth buds because she has an IPhone.
Also has a standard 3.5 cable and a 1/4 inch adapter. So I just swap em.
I don't have that kind of need.  Bose QC35 and Sennheiser hd 4.40
oh it turns wired into wireless buds I see
damn apple making everything so complictaed
MMCX cables are great. Turn anything into anything else.
Yeah, Ord. It wasn't purely cuz I wanted them. Though I totally did. Also like to keep work in mind, so a totally flat response was something I was looking for in these.
Hence, they are not great for music and general media consumption.
The 215s are bangers though for music.
consumer stuff is a-ok for what I need!
No joke, the 215s replaced everything else I use. OCCASIONALLY I'll pop in something else for reference, but otherwise...
Yeah, I've noticed Sennheiser is more an "accurate"/true listening experience, they don't over compensate for the bass.
That's the reason beats were popular
all personal opinion and preference though

Should I be worried if a retail job starts going, "This is kinda hurting the business" when you request less hours?
Because not sure if well-intentioned support for the business or manipulation to get more labor...
Yeah that sounds like they’re trying to appea; to your feelings without actually telling you how much they value you?
“You’re the best employee we have, holding the place together, if you could work more again, that’d be GREAAAT”
I like my manager, but it's a bit worrying, because it's 1 day less a week
And the store ALWAYS seems to be shortstaffed.
Bruh, don't you already only work like 2 opr 3 days?
Yeah, at that point I can see why they're tired of scheduling around you.
Part timers are hella tiring to work with as a manager. People who are only around 2-3 days a week means everyone else has to move their schedules around you.
The shifts the part timer doesn't work means someone else has to pick up overtime.
Speaking of, time for me to head out o/
